summary: This document is an email chain between prosecutors from the Manhattan District Attorney's Office (DANY) and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) discussing an investigation into sexual assault allegations against Leon Black. The emails detail the status of DANY's investigation into a victim who was also trafficked by Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein, jurisdictional issues, and coordination between the offices.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: Billionaire financier accused of sexual assault in 2001 in NYC; investigation being conducted by the Manhattan District Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Jeanne
persons.context: Recently retained by the victim; relayed information to DANY and indicated she would speak with the prosecutors about Leon Black and another target.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as someone who trafficked the victim, connecting the case to the Epstein network.

events.title: Alleged sexual assault by Leon Black

keyFacts: The Manhattan District Attorney's Office (DANY) is investigating Leon Black for an alleged sexual assault in NYC in 2001.
The victim in the investigation was also trafficked by Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein, linking the case to the broader Epstein network.
DANY's investigation is limited to one incident in NYC; other conduct and potential targets fall outside their jurisdictional scope.
The victim has recently retained attorney Jeanne, who is willing to share more information with prosecutors.
DANY finds the victim credible partly due to similarities in the alleged sexual assault (biting) to other cases, but charges seem unlikely due to lack of corroboration.
